page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: My home is an interwar house built in 1922.The rates are Â£200 per year.To sell my house today we would get about Â£14000. It is a three bedroomed house with an upstairs bathroom.We have a backyard,no garden and no garage.The outer buildings in the yard are a toilet,a coal house and a shed.My house has 2 public rooms. The houses in Craghead range in age from pre 1914 terraced houses to post-war,local authority semi-detached.The rates are between Â£150 and Â£200 per year depending on the age of the house.Today to buy a house in Craghead,you would pay from Â£7000 upwards.The rent is about Â£18 per week upwards.
